newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas futures trade to start with exchange rate.
newsitem.headline: Caracas futures trade to start with exchange rate.

text.p: Venezuela's first futures market, due to lift off on May 23, will start trading with the bolivar/dollar exchange rate, the president of the options and futures chamber Cacofv said Wednesday.
"The first contracts which will be negotiated will be on the future of the exchange rate," Cacofv President Jose Gonzalo Muci told a news conference.
Contracts would be a maximum of $20,000. "In other countries the contracts are much larger, but we think these amounts are appropriate for the size of the local market," he said.
Muci said interest rate and stock exchange index futures would follow. Options on the same indicators would come later, he added.
Cacofv counts the country's largest banks among its shareholders including Banco Provincial, Mercantil and Union.
